summary:
I love puzzles, trying out new things, talking about ideas and rallying the troops around a common goal. I believe the agile mindset is the mindset of the future - in order to deliver value continuously, we must make people awesome, give them a safe space to be at their best and let them experiment, fail and learn from their mistakes.
Ever since I got my first internship on the QA team of an open source startup, I have been fascinated by how all the pieces in the software development lifecycle fit, what are the challenges at each step and what makes teams successful. During the first years of my career as a software developer, I helped our teams establish good architecture standards by crashing our production servers on my first go-live night with a new piece of code no one had used before. My boss called it "fail forward" - it's not bad to make a mistake, as long as we learn from it. 
Later on, as a consultant in a Big Four, I've tried to purposefully crash systems, in order to test them, have advised many clients on the quality of their software systems and how to address certain challenges, such as legacy software, scaling, maintainability and usability and I've even written some code. But the projects that gave me the most energy and taught me the most were always centered around teams - from being the product owner for the most amazing and accepting banking app team, to being the Scrum Master and coach for my own colleagues, to leading a team that successfully developed a novel static code analysis tool for a client, so they can embark on their continuous quality journey.

When I am not moonlighting as an all-around IT nerd and an agile coach, I am a mom of a very bright and determined toddler who always wants to learn about everything. Raising him showed me something important - we all start with an agile mindset - an infinite capacity for learning and the burning desire to try again, and again, until we get it right. 

So, if you are wondering how to introduce Agile into a traditional organization without mentioning the word Agile, or how to improve a complex development process with multiple stakeholders across a few continents, or how to get the creative juices flowing in your teams, do reach out, I'd love to help!

awards.title: Winner StrICTly for Business event
awards.description:
Winner as part of Leiden University Team 'We Mean Business' of the third  StrICTly for Business event organized by CIO Platform Nederland. The winning case was on 'Successful SaaS implementation in the Shell IT ecosystem' in collaboration with Shell and CZ.

contributors.headline: Lead Cloud Business Advisor at Pega
Professional dreamer with an itch to build!

profile_positions.description:
I am currently part of the Digital Enablement group of KPMG Digital in Amstelveen where I focus on software quality, Agile software development and Agile coaching. My projects are very diverse - from strategic advice based on software quality reviews, to Agile project management, software architecture and software development processes, to coaching agile teams.
My past experience as a software developer, product owner, release manager and tester gives me a an end-to-end perspective of the software development process and the challenges of digitalization. I am also a certified Agile coach and I firmly believe in the power of the Agile mindset.
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant Digital Enablement

profile_positions.description: Part of KPMG's  CoE on banking supervision (ECB Office) in Frankfurt, Germany. KPMG’s ECB Office supports clients and our firm in dealing with key issues related the European Central Bank (ECB) under the Single Supervisory Mechanism (SSM) and the Single Resolution Board (SRB). My focus is on IT topics related to banking supervision (e.g. PSD2) and how we help our clients respond to new regulation.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Manager

profile_positions.description:
Energetic and driven IT consultant, specializing in Agile methods, project management and delivery of IT software projects as well as software quality.
Projects include Technical coordinator and Scrum master for a program of IT software delivery projects, software quality analysis for various software systems, end-to-end performance testing of a large bank software system, test and release coordination for large multinational oil company.
Most current assignment - Business Testing coordinator for large project at a multinational oil and gas company.
profile_positions.title: Management Consultant (IT Advisory)

profile_positions.description:
Master Thesis Internship
Working on MSc research project on Extending the context of agility in organizations – which agile principles and practices can be applied to portfolio management. Developed a conceptual model for program and portfolio management of agile software development projects, based on theoretical models from industry and agile practices. Model was verified via expert interviews at 8 organizations in the Netherlands and USA.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

profile_positions.description:
•	MSc ICT in Business, GPA: 8.3	
•	Courses completed: Change Management, Lean Six Sigma, ICT Architectures, ICT Strategy and Planning, Strategy Formation and Implementation, Advanced Software Development, Organizing, Managing People, Behavioral Decision Making, Corporate Finance, Financial Accounting, Software Development and Project Management, Global Marketing and Corporate Communications, Process Modelling, Management Science, Managing Innovation, ICT-enabled Process Innovation
profile_positions.title: MSc, ICT in Business

profile_positions.description:
Programmer Analyst II on the eCommerce team.
•	Developer for the Help Me Choose Foundations project (August 2010 – June 2011)
    Worked as part of the Foundations team to build a scalable product selection tool that will be used by future projects. Duties included design and implementation of JSF components, as well as Product Selection Rules Engine, based on JBoss Drules platform. 

•	Developer for the Online Catalog Conversion project (February 2010 – August 2010)
    Worked as part of a large team with multiple business clients and complex dependencies with other projects. Duties included converting pages from JSP to JSF facelets, updating third-party dependencies with other projects to use more object-oriented and modular code that is easier to upgrade moving forward. Also optimized old code for better performance, automated deploys to development and test environments, trained team members on code review best practices.

•	Lead Developer for the PartsList project (October 2008 – January 2010) – www.ni.com/partslist
    PartsList is a feature-rich JSF web application for creating custom system proposals and browsing National Instruments products. As Lead Developer coordinated tasks among a team of three developers, interfacing with web systems architects and business clients, lead design discussions, created and coordinated testing plans and monthly releases.

•	Developer for the PartsList project (February 2008 – October 2008)
Developed JSF facelets and templates, worked closely with UI designers on front end presentation as well as with architects on backend implementation – web services and PL/SQL packages to interface with the database.

•	Lead Developer for the iLogin project (August 2007 – February 2008)
Designed and implemented two Java Web Services to interface our contract and IP information in order to provide geo-tagging for eCRM Marketing strategies.
profile_positions.title: Programmer Analyst

volunteer_experiences.description: Click to edit position descriptionWorked as a Citizen School Teacher for the Robotics Apprenticeship. Citizen Schools is a non-profit organization that works with middle schools to expand the learning day for children in low-income communities across the US. As a volunteer for the Robotics Apprenticeship I taught 6 through 8 grade students about science, robotics and how to build and program a robot using Lego Mindstorms and NXT. Main focus of the class, besides building robots was to show the importance of science and technology in everyday life, as well as encourage students to continue their education
Substitute teacher for Bulgaarse school Leiden.
